name: S.E Correos y Telégrafos S.A., S.M.E.
bossPosition: Director of CSR and International Affairs
goal:
Correos is a state-owned group that provides services in four main fields:
- Postal and Parcels delivery (Correos)
- Express parcel delivery (Correos express)
- Massive Telecommunications for business (Nexea)
- Telecommunications network (Correos Telecom)

Correos is the designated operator for providing the Universal Postal Service in Spain.
The Correos strategic action plan “100-300-1.500” sets several targets with the aim of achieving a high degree of diversification, to improve the productivity and effectiveness of the company by 2017.
Today, we have become the best physic and digital delivery provider in Spain as a result of the improvement of our efficiency, quality and sustainability and thanks to the combination of the work of the best professionals, our extensive network and our innovative equipment. We are part of the citizens, business and Public Administration daily life. Correos is a trustfull company committed with the use the innovation as a tool for helping its clients.
interests: Communication, Competition, Culture and media, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, International co-operation and development, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives:
- Following Postal Directives and the application report of the third Postal Directive.
- Following the debates and work on Services of General Economic Interest and the rulings on State Aid.
- Proposal of Regulation on the Cross-border parcel delivery services.
- Review of the Regulation Data Protection in the electronic communication sector.
- DSM strategy, VAT exemptions, e-identification and e-government norms.
- Transport white paper.
- Customs Union Code.
- International trade: free exchange agreements, especially the negotiation of the TIPA and TTIP agreements.
